title: Convert amounts into first equation
text: Let's use "a" as the number of adult tickets and "c" as the number of childrens tickets. The total number of tickets combined is $$1650$$, therefore we can determine that the first equation is $$a+c=1, 650$$

title: Convert amoutn into second equation
text: Because the total amount of money made was $47,150 and adult tickets are $35 and childrens $15 we can determine that the second equation is $$35a+15c=47, 150$$

title: Isolate Variable
text: Let's use the first equation to isolate c. With the equation, we can subtract a from both sides to get $$c=1, 650-a$$

title: Plug in
text: We can plug in $$c=1, 650-a$$ using the second equation to get $$35a+15(1,650-a)=47,150$$

title: Solve for a
text: We can determine that the second equation after plugging in "c" would be 20a+24,750=47,150. We now isolate the variable "a" and get $$20a=22, 400$$. Then, we can divide both sides by $$20$$ to get $$a=1, 120$$.

title: Solve for c
text: After solving for "a", we can plug that value into the first equation to get 1,120+c=1,650 which we can determine "c" to be $$530$$.
